intro: Wissadula periplocifolia var. gracillima, commonly known as the slender leaf wissadula, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare in the wild.
